item.title: NIDANA launches July 28
item.content:encoded:
• PC

She continues to dream.

NIDANA, a “first-person dream simulator where you explore the corner of a dream,” will launch for PC via Steam on July 28, publisher PLAYISM and developer lvl374 announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via PLAYISM:

She continues to dream.

This is a first-person dream walking simulator where you explore a corner of a dream.

item.title: Aniplex, JOYCITY, and Capcom announce Resident Evil: Survival Unit for iOS, Android
item.content:encoded:
• Smartphone

Online showcase event set for July 10.

Aniplex has announced Resident Evil: Survival Unit, a new strategy game co-developed with JOYCITY in close collaboration with Capcom. It will launch for iOS and Android across North America, Europe, Japan, South Korea, and Asia.

“Resident Evil: Survival Unit offers a fresh take on the beloved franchise, reimagining the survival horror universe as a real-time strategy experience optimized for mobile platforms, iOS and Android,” reads the press release. “The game is designed to appeal to both longtime fans and new players.”

An online showcase event will be held on July 10 at 3:00 p.m. PT / 6:00 p.m. ET. You will be able to watch it on YouTube (English, Japanese).

Stay tuned.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/aniplex-joycity-and-capcom-announce-resident-evil-survival-unit-for-ios-android

item.title: Illusion of Itehari launches September 18 in the west
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Otome visual novel dated.

Otome visual novel Illusion of Itehari, known as Utakata no Uchronia in Japan, will launch for Switch on September 18 in the west, publisher Aksys Games announced.

An edition of the game featuring the original soundtrack will be available exclusively through Aksys Games Online Store.

Here is an overview of the game, via Aksys Games:

In Itehari, the renowned and prosperous floating utopia, Hinagiku longs for the world beyond. One day, Hinagiku, having just turned 18 years old, encounters an amnesiac man. Their chance meeting drags her into a series of events involving the secrets and various truths hidden beneath the surface of Itehari… for this garden in the sky is a false utopia. Illusion of Itehari is a completely new otome game project created by a renowned group of artists and staff, and the first project from “LicoBiTs,” a joint venture by Broccoli and TIS Creation aimed at making games for the female audience.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/illusion-of-itehari-launches-september-18-in-the-west

item.title: Project Code M by NOVECT to be published by Aksys Games
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch

Long-awaited "killing and solving detective adventure game" from The House in Fata Morgana studio.

Aksys Games will publish Project Code M, the new “killing and solving detective adventure game” from The House in Fata Morgana developer NOVECT, the company announced. A release date was not announced.

Project Code M was first announced for PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC (Steam) in May 2022.

While the press release issued by Aksys Game lists platforms as “to be announced,” the trailer includes PlayStation 5 and Switch logos.

Here is an overview of the game, via Aksys Games:

We are excited to announce Project Code M, a mystery game currently in development where you seek the truth behind a series of murders from the perspectives of both the killer and the investigator. The story takes place in present day Tokyo, focusing on the Shitamachi area such as Asakusa and Yoshiwara, and involves Japan’s criminal underworld. As the murderer, set your trap, corner the target and commit your crime. The style of murder will unfold differently depending on the situation. As the investigator, uncover the truth by searching for clues and questioning witnesses. More details coming soon!

Watch a new trailer below.

Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/project-code-m-by-novect-to-be-published-by-aksys-games

item.title: Otome Daoshi: Fighting for Love coming west in spring 2026
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Published by Aksys Games.

Aksys Games will release Idea Factory-developed otome visual novel Otome Daoshi: Fighting for Love for Switch in spring 2026 in the west, the publisher announced.

Otome Daoshi: Fighting for Love first launched for Switch on September 26, 2024 in Japan.

Here is an overview of the game, via Aksys Games:

Decades ago, a famous landscape artist was brutally murdered while painting late at night. At that time irregularities were found in the case and the primary suspect died in an apparent suicide. The case was closed and, over time, nearly forgotten. Thirty years later your university club, the Mystery Research Club, pries open old wounds, revisiting this unsolved case as a research assignment. Unexpected new clues are revealed as you use your secret ability to peer into the past, viewing key items and events in a new light. Use your uniquely gained knowledge to steer conversations and interviews with witnesses and potential suspects. Maintain your own secrets while uncovering a series of long-buried mysteries leading to the true killer.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Western Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/otome-daoshi-fighting-for-love-coming-west-in-spring-2026

item.title: C.A.R.D.S. RPG: The Misty Battlefield physical edition launches this fall in the west
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch

Currently available digitally.

Aksys Games will release a physical edition of ACQUIRE-developed roguelike deckbuilder strategy RPG C.A.R.D.S. RPG: The Misty Battlefield for PlayStation 5 and Switch this fall in the west, the publisher announced.

C.A.R.D.S. RPG: The Misty Battlefield launched digitally for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC via Steam on May 23, 2024 worldwide. A physical edition was released in Japan on the same date.

Here is an overview of the game, via Aksys Games:

An expanded version of the game that combines roguelike-style deckbuilding with strategy RPGs. Enjoy unique tactical gameplay that features over 100 varieties of cards with unique designs allowing players to build powerful decks and strategically confront enemies on an SRPG field. Every encounter requires a different strategy! Adapt to new battlegrounds and plan accordingly. Build the strongest deck and put a stop to the Hellmuth Brigade’s actions. The new “Mini-Game” mode lets players select a single unit and navigate a grid-based map, engaging in battles, upgrading, and making critical decisions. Your route and deck-building choices within limited turns will determine your success against the boss!

Watch a new trailer below.

Physical Edition Announce Trailer

item.title: Q Collection announced for Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Includes Q REMASTERED, Q with VTUBERS, and Q2 HUMANITY.

Publisher Aksys Games and developer liica have announced Q Collection for Switch. It includes puzzle games Q REMASTERED, Q with VTUBERS, and Q2 HUMANITY. It will launch in 2026.

Here is an overview of teh collection, via Aksys Games:

The Q puzzle series now makes its way to the Nintendo Switch as a collection of three games! With over 1,800 problems to solve, you’re bound to be entertained, whether you’d like to take on the challenges yourself or as a group. Q REMASTERED is a simple puzzle game in which players can freely draw lines and shapes on the screen. The drawn object will drop due to gravity. Q with VTUBERS features challenging and quirky puzzles designed by over 20 VTubers. The sequel Q2 HUMANITY introduces characters or “humans” that can jump, bounce, throw things, and sometimes even exhibit special abilities. Q2 can be played solo or with up to four players.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/q-collection-announced-for-switch
